of contemporary science is to promote
the quality of life for all creatures. This primarily entails the
creation of novel drugs and improving the methods for synthesizing
already-existing pharmaceuticals in a medicinal context. Due to the
presence of the amino group in many natural and agricultural products,   Reductive
aminations (RA) constitute a significant class of reactions
widely applied in research laboratories and industries for the synthesis
of amines as well as pharmaceuticals, agrochemicals, and biomolecules.   Para Escherichia coli  This report presents an optimized procedure, based on literature
methods, for the synthesis and spectroscopic characterization of 4-(benzylamino)­benzoic
acid derivatives.  Scheme 1 Synthesis of 1 19 i ii 1 19 4 2 Experimental Section 2.1 General All solvents and commercial
reagents ( p- p- p- p m- p- m o m- p- 2.2 Instruments TLC was performed on
Merck silica gel 60 F254. NMR spectra were recorded on a Bruker-Avance
400 MHz spectrometer. The residual solvent protons ( 1 13 1 –1 –1 –5 2.3 Single-Crystal X-ray Diffraction Measurements
(SC-XRD) SC-XRD data for compounds 2 4 7 9 11 2.4 Hirshfeld Surfaces Hirshfeld surfaces
of 2 4 7 9 11 d norm d e d i 2.5 Computational All calculations and
geometry optimizations of 1–19 2.6 Cell Subculture and Growth Conditions Dulbecco’s Modified Eagle Medium (DMEM), Roswell Park Memorial
Institute (RPMI)-1640 Medium (RPMI), and Dulbecco’s Phosphate
Buffered Saline (PBS) were purchased from Euroclone. Heat inactivated
Fetal Bovine Serum (FBS) was purchased from Capricorn Scientific.
Three different types of cell lines were purchased from ATCC. HGF
cells were grown in 10% FBS/DMEM, while A549 and H69 cells were grown
in 10% FBS/R. Cells were incubated at 310 K in humidified air atmosphere
of 5% CO 2 2.7 Cell Viability Assays Using Resazurin Dye
Method Resazurin sodium salt was purchased from Sigma-Aldrich.
Compounds 1–19  2.8 Antibacterial Activity The antibacterial
activities were tested by evaluating the antibacterial behavior of
the synthesized 4-(benzyl)­amino)­benzoic acid derivatives against six
different pathogenic bacteria, which were obtained from the Ministry
of Health-Jordan, using two different methods: the agar diffusion
method and the microbroth dilution method to determine the Minimum
Inhibitory Concentration (MIC, μg/mL) as reported previously.  2.9 General Procedure for Reductive Amination
Reaction between 4-Aminobenzoic Acid and Benzaldehyde Derivatives
to Produce 4-(Benzylamino)­Benzoic Acid Derivatives The 4-(benzylamino)
benzoic acid derivatives were synthesized by the reductive amination
reaction as shown in Scheme P 2.9.1 Synthesis of 4-(Benzylamino)­benzoic Acid

on the

to be the
cause of the higher activity observed against Gram-negative bacteria,
a major component of the surface of such organisms. LPS is a
major entity in determining the virulence and pathogenicity
of Gram-negative bacteria and the effectiveness of the outer membrane
barrier function. 4 Conclusion A simple synthetic method
